content.description: Typical Gunks diagonal fingercrack/face combo.  Might be awkward for those without good foot technique.  Reminded me a bit of Ken's Crack, except without the bomber fingerlocks.
content.protection: Adequate protection on lead.  Please make certain to place several directionals on the route if you TR it; the route goes off at a good angle, and the potential pendulum isn't pleasant.  Gear-only anchor.
content.location: As you approach the Big Slab/Compactor area, you'll notice the alcove directly ahead and a large slab on the left.  Slant Crack is on the left wall, just before the alcove; follow the diagonal crack to top, step out and around to the face, straight to top.  A walk-off is possible, but it involves a bit of a class 4 scramble to get to the very top of the cliff where you'll find the path.

content.description: A very shady route; this one starts in a decent alcove and rarely sees the light of day.  Not climbed often.
content.protection: Barely adequate, with a nasty fall.  Gear-only anchor.
content.location: Inside the alcove, on the right wall of the alcove, climb up the tallest block to the first seam on the right.  Follow the seam to the top.

content.description:
Begin on the right side of the slab. Continue climbing straight up until you reach a ledge below three overhangs. Climb past the three overhangs onto another ledge, then top out up the corner.

 Can be split into two pitches.
content.protection: Standard rack, and you'll probably want a 4-inch piece.
content.location: Start on climber's right of the large, low angle slab.

content.description: Good for hot, sunny days as both of these routes are in perpetual shade.  Easy approach.
